availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James O'Hara, Jr. (Kenton County, KY, attorney)

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, attorney. New Liberty, Kentucky, native. Son of James O’Hara, Sr., and Lucy O’Hara. Attended law school at St. Mary’s College in Marion County, Kentucky. Married to Oberia Conn O’Hara. Father of Susannah O’Hara. Attorney in Williamstown, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in 1850. Attorney in Covington in 1860. Household owned three enslaved persons in Covington in 1860. Formed a law partnership with John G. Carlisle from 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 361A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 7.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 4, page 697.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slaves Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 4, page 2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, p. 230B.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport – Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Roll # 7012978: Covington, Certificates 1-772 (1893), certificate #19, p. 499 of microfilm; and film 7013567 (1900), certificate #736, p. 491 of microfilm.
H. Levin, The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 757-759.
Find A Grave, "James O’Hara (1825-1900)," Memorial #84402453, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84402453/james-o'hara# (accessed September 5, 2018).
